Class ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator

java.lang.Object
ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator
public class ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator extends Object
A class to aid in the creation of strings that use ANSI escape codes
Version:
1.1
Author:
Eric Heinke (sudo-Eric)

    • bell

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator bell()

      Bell

      This will trigger the ASCII bell.

      • Windows: this plays the alert sound
      • OSX: ???
      • Linux: ???
      Returns:
      Self reference

    • backspace

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator backspace()

      Backspace

      This will add the ASCII backspace character
      Moves the cursor left (but may "backwards wrap" if cursor is at start of line)

      Returns:
      Self reference

    • tab

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator tab()

      Tab

      This will add the ASCII tab character
      Moves the cursor right to next multiple of 8

      Returns:
      Self reference

    • line_feed

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator line_feed()

      Line feed

      This will add the ASCII line feed character
      Moves to next line, scrolls the display up if at bottom of the screen
      Usually does not move horizontally, though programs should not rely on this

      Returns:
      Self reference

    • form_feed

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator form_feed()

      Form feed

      This will add teh ASCII form feed character
      Move a printer to top of next page
      Usually does not move horizontally, though programs should not rely on this

      Effect on video terminals varies

      Returns:
      Self reference

    • carriage_return

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator carriage_return()

      Carriage return

      This will add the ASCII carriage return character
      Moves the cursor to column zero

      Returns:
      Self reference

    • escape

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator escape()

      Escape

      This will add the ASCII escape character
      Starts all the escape sequences

      Returns:
      Self reference

    • erase_display

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator erase_display​(int n)

      Erase part or the entirety of the display

      n = 0 | clear from cursor to end of screen
      n = 1 | clear from cursor to beginning of the screen
      n = 2 | clear entire screen
      n = 3 | clear entire screen and delete all lines saved in the scrollback buffer

      Parameters:
      n - Erasure mode
      Returns:
      Self reference

    • erase_display

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator erase_display()
      Erase the entirety of the display (clear entire screen)
      Returns:
      Self reference

    • erase_line

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator erase_line​(int n)

      Erase part ot the entirety of the present line

      n = 0 | clear from cursor to the end of the line
      n = 1 | clear from cursor to beginning of the line
      n = 2 | clear entire line

      Parameters:
      n - Erasure mode
      Returns:
      Self reference

    • erase_line

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator erase_line()

    • SGR_conceal

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator SGR_conceal()

      Conceal (hide)

      Not widely supported

      Self reference

      public ANSI_Escape_Code_Creator SGR_normal_script()
